snippet: Nineteen of the Assyrian Christians seized by Islamic State militants last week in northeastern Syria have been freed, and they met with church officials in a cathedral in the city of Hasaka, local leaders said Sunday.
abstract: Local leaders say 19 of group of Assyrian Christians kidnapped by Islamic State militants in northeastern Syria have been freed, and they met with church officials in a cathedral in the city of Hasaka.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and ANNE BARNARD

lead_paragraph: Nineteen of the Assyrian Christians seized by Islamic State militants last week in northeastern Syria have been freed, and they met with church officials in a cathedral in the city of Hasaka, local leaders said Sunday.

headline.main: Syria: 19 Christians Have Been Released by the Islamic State, Local Leaders Say
headline.print_headline: Syria: 19 Christians Have Been Released by the Islamic State, Local Leaders Say

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
